title: Gothic Astronomy Tower Adventure #19
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Gothic Observation Deck
rooms.description: A circular stone chamber with tall arched windows overlooking a moonlit landscape. Ancient astronomical instruments line the walls, their brass surfaces tarnished with age. Star charts and celestial maps are pinned to wooden boards. The air is cold and still, carrying the scent of old parchment and metal. Gargoyles peer down from the vaulted ceiling.

items.name: astronomer's desk
items.description: A heavy oak desk covered with papers, charts, and astronomical calculations

items.name: astronomer's journal
items.description: A leather bound journal with detailed observations
items.text: Day 127: This tower was built in 1543 by Lord Blackwood to study the heavens. My observations continue from the Star Chamber above. The celestial sphere reveals eight planets in our solar system. Only those who understand the cosmos may access the telescope dome.

items.name: ornate brass key
items.description: A key engraved with constellation patterns

items.name: collection of star charts
items.description: Ancient maps showing constellations and planetary movements
items.text: These charts map the night sky as observed from this tower. Notes indicate: 'The Star Chamber contains the most powerful instruments. Lord Blackwood's telescope in the dome above can see to the edge of the universe.'

items.name: ancient astrolabe
items.description: A complex brass instrument for measuring celestial positions

items.name: folded note
items.description: A note tucked inside the astrolabe mechanism
items.text: The combination to my desk drawer is the year this magnificent tower was constructed. I have locked my most precious instruments in the iron bound chest. The key is with my personal effects. - Lord Blackwood

items.name: iron bound chest
items.description: A sturdy chest reinforced with iron bands and a brass lock

items.name: silver key
items.description: A delicate silver key with moon phases engraved on it

items.name: observation log
items.description: A detailed record of astronomical observations
items.text: Lord Blackwood's Log: From this tower, I have catalogued the movements of eight planets. The Star Chamber holds my greatest instruments. To reach the telescope dome, one must answer the three celestial questions inscribed upon the door.

items.name: small telescope on stand
items.description: A brass telescope pointed toward the windows

items.name: spiral stone staircase
items.description: A winding staircase carved from stone, leading upward to the Star Chamber

rooms.name: Star Chamber
rooms.description: A magnificent chamber with a domed ceiling painted to depict the night sky. Constellations shimmer with gold leaf against deep blue. A massive orrery dominates the center, its brass planets frozen in their orbits. Floor to ceiling bookshelves line the walls, filled with astronomical texts. Moonlight streams through a circular skylight.

items.name: grand mechanical orrery
items.description: An intricate model of the solar system with brass planets on curved arms
items.text: The orrery shows the sun at the center with eight planets orbiting around it. A plaque reads: 'Built by Lord Blackwood, 1543. The cosmos reveals its secrets to those who observe with patience.'

items.name: floor to ceiling bookshelf
items.description: Towering shelves packed with leather bound volumes on astronomy and mathematics

items.name: treatise on celestial mechanics
items.description: A thick volume with detailed astronomical knowledge
items.text: Chapter 5: The Solar System contains eight known planets orbiting our sun. The telescope dome at the tower's peak houses Lord Blackwood's masterwork - a telescope powerful enough to observe distant galaxies. Access requires knowledge of the cosmos.

items.name: scholar's writing desk
items.description: A desk with inkwells, quills, and stacks of calculations

items.name: detailed celestial map
items.description: A beautifully illustrated map of the heavens
items.text: This map charts the visible universe as seen from the tower. Annotations note: 'Eight planets circle our sun. The telescope dome provides the ultimate vantage point. Lord Blackwood spent his life studying the stars from this tower.'

items.name: marble pedestal
items.description: A pedestal holding various astronomical instruments

items.name: brass compass
items.description: A navigational compass with ornate engravings

items.name: navigation sextant
items.description: An instrument for measuring angles between celestial objects

items.name: painted dome ceiling
items.description: A breathtaking fresco of the night sky with constellations
items.text: The dome depicts the cosmos in stunning detail. Constellations are labeled in Latin. At the apex, an inscription reads: 'Per aspera ad astra - Through hardships to the stars.'

items.name: gothic stone archway
items.description: A pointed arch doorway leading to the telescope dome. Three questions are carved into the stone lintel.

password_questions.question: How many planets orbit our sun?
password_questions.hint: Check the orrery, the astronomy treatise, and the celestial map

password_questions.question: What is housed in the telescope dome?
password_questions.hint: Multiple texts mention what Lord Blackwood built at the tower's peak

password_questions.question: Who built this tower?
password_questions.hint: The journal, observation log, and various inscriptions name the builder

rooms.name: Telescope Dome
rooms.description: You have reached the pinnacle of the Gothic Astronomy Tower! A massive telescope points toward the heavens through an open dome. Stars blaze brilliantly in the night sky above. The telescope's brass and glass construction gleams in the moonlight. A spiral staircase leads down to a hidden exit - your escape route to freedom.

items.name: Lord Blackwood's telescope
items.description: A magnificent telescope of unprecedented size and craftsmanship, pointed at the cosmos

items.name: observation platform
items.description: A circular platform surrounding the telescope with brass railings

items.name: rotating dome mechanism
items.description: Gears and chains that allow the dome to rotate and open to the sky

items.name: final observation log
items.description: Lord Blackwood's last entries, left beside the telescope
items.text: My life's work is complete. This telescope reveals wonders beyond imagination. From this tower, I have touched the infinite. May future astronomers continue the quest for knowledge. The stars await.

rooms.win_message: You have reached the telescope dome at the tower's peak! Through Lord Blackwood's magnificent telescope, you glimpse the infinite cosmos. The mysteries of the Gothic Astronomy Tower are solved. A hidden staircase leads you safely down and out into the night. You have escaped and won!
